AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS repeatedly framed the blank/empty graphs as “normal behavior” due to no traffic, despite the customer later stating there was traffic during the missing periods and internal analysis suggesting a roll-up/data aggregation issue. This is potentially misleading and shows weak adaptation to new info. Some responses also appear repetitive/filler-heavy rather than moving troubleshooting forward.
evidence: ATLAS (public, 2025-11-04): "The “Data not available for selected period” message occurs when no traffic has been recorded for the selected subnet or network object during the specified time range. This is a normal behavior in Exinda reporting. It does not indicate a malfunction..."
Customer (private, 2025-11-07): "there was traffic over the link on the mentioned period, but it was not present on exinda subnet report."
ATLAS (public, 2025-11-09): "This behavior is in line with normal Exinda operation; there is no evidence of a firmware or reporting engine malfunction."

Rishi Singh (private, 2025-11-14): "Because traffic is visible for certain periods but rolled-up time ranges (Last 24 Hours) are empty, the problem is almost certainly in the data-roll-up chain (datad / monitor / statisticsd) rather than capture."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer explicitly requested a call and expressed frustration that they are repeatedly asked to provide information without receiving corrective action, suggesting a loop-like experience and difficulty getting effective human-driven troubleshooting. While humans did respond, the customer experience still reflects “stuck in the process” dynamics.
evidence: Customer (private, 2025-11-14): "can you schedule a call because from last 1 month we are only sharing data for verification ."
Customer (private, 2025-11-19): "Kindly confirm are you able to initiate a call for troubleshooting or not ... we have not received a single recommendation / corrective action from your side."
Customer (private, 2025-11-19): "can you tell us that how many times you need same data. Have you checked previous update on this ticket provides by us?"

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: There are clear signals that support requested the same artifacts again or did not leverage what the customer believed was already provided, forcing repetition. The customer directly calls out repeated requests and lack of review of prior updates, indicating context may not have been consumed or acknowledged.
evidence: Customer (private, 2025-11-19): "can you tell us that how many times you need same data. Have you checked previous update on this ticket provides by us?"

Customer (private, 2025-11-14): "We have verified all the parameters and also observed that there is traffic on particular time period, but it is not showing on last 24 hours in exinda"

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The timeline shows prolonged gaps and repeated customer follow-ups over days and then a month without meaningful progress. The customer explicitly complains about waiting 6 days and then 1 month, and the case even triggers escalation events due to delay.

This is a closure-pressure/auto-close warning that can be premature given the unresolved nature of the issue at those points.

This pattern suggests high-severity handling may have been insufficient or slow.
